meanings.sent1: After the fish stole the bait, he had to rebait the hook.
meanings.sent2: The fisherman decided to rebait the trap to catch more fish.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel kept stealing the nuts, so he had to rebait the trap.
meanings.sent4: She had to rebait her plan to attract more customers to the store.
meanings.sent5: In order to catch the mouse, he had to rebait the mousetrap with cheese.

meanings.sent1: The angler needed to rebait the hook with a juicy worm.
meanings.sent2: The fisherman always makes sure to rebait the fishing line with fresh bait.
meanings.sent3: The cat kept ignoring the food, so she had to rebait the bowl with a different treat.
meanings.sent4: She had to rebait the bird feeder with new seeds to attract more birds.

meanings.definition: To renew an offer or incentive.
meanings.sent1: The store decided to rebait the promotion to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: The company always rebaits their loyalty program to keep customers engaged.
meanings.sent3: The kids were not interested, so she had to rebait the deal with a new game.
meanings.sent4: She had to rebait the discount to encourage more people to buy.
meanings.sent5: In order to boost sales, he had to rebait the special offer with a limited-time discount.
